entry.title: Endlessly trying

Author: Eminet_2

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 16,193Chapters: 8/15Kudos: 65

Summary: Gods didn’t exist. At least that’s what Stiles believed at first. But since Stiles has seen literal werewolves he should probably not assume much about the current state of reality.Alas, gods exist, or maybe he’s hallucinating. Considering he’s been playing around a bunch of Deaton’s books (which he stole) trying to find a solution to the alpha pack problem and ended up dreaming about well… someone who looks like the physical manifestation of hot topic.

entry.title: Frozen Lines
entry.summary:
Author: am0ra

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 112,666Chapters: 14/?Kudos: 91

Summary: The ice was his sanctuary. His home.But outside the rink, everything was war.Stiles carried a past full of pain—silent wounds no one could see. And Derek, the unyielding captain of the basketball team, was the last person he wanted to face.Enemies bound by pride, secrets, and unspoken grudges.In a town where trust shatters like thin ice, their collision is inevitable.Can two broken souls break down the walls between them? Or will the fight destroy everything, including what they never expected to find: each other?The ice will always be his sanctuary. But maybe, for the first time, the battle is worth fighting off the rink.

entry.title: Casus Belli
entry.summary:
Author: Dexterous_Sinistrous

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 15,599Chapters: 2/4Kudos: 94

Summary: “I’m supposed to take care of you,” Derek started.“Shut up,” Stiles stated with no heat. He looked up at Derek. “When are you going to get it that I like taking care of you too?”Derek weakly shook his head. “I’m not good enough, Stiles.”Stiles’ features sunk. “Don’t I get to decide that?” He stood, dropping the towel he had been using to help move the blanket. “Just… get in bed, Derek. We can talk later.”Derek remembered touching Stiles’ wrist. “I should have died that night we met.”“Not when I have anything to do with it,” Stiles replied.~*~The one where "touch him and die" is a promise both Derek and Stiles live by

entry.title: His Guardian Angel
entry.summary:
Author: sterektaboosmut

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 9,343Chapters: 5/?Kudos: 25

Summary: I've always had an overprotective streak when it comes to my younger brother, Stiles. He's as sweet as they come. Innocent as hell, or should I say, Heaven. He's in his first year of college, away from home, away from me. Surrounded by hundreds of horny students, waiting for the perfect time to take advantage of him. I know, because everyone wants him.If I didn't keep an eye on him, someone would take him, make him their own. And I can't let that happen. I have to make sure he stays pure, make sure he saves himself for a man that's worthy of him. But there's only one person who can take Stiles.He is mine, he just doesn't know it yet. He may be far from me, but I'm always watching over him. Like his guardian angel. Because I love him. And when he needs me, I need to make sure I'm there, ready for anything.No one will touch what's mine.Stiles won't let it.I won't let it.

entry.title: Blood Magick
entry.summary:
Author: misfitmonarchy

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 41,330Chapters: 7/7Kudos: 141

Summary: “Freeze! You--” Derek lunges and catches the wildling’s ankle. He grins, all teeth, and yanks the scrambling man so that the wildling’s body falls flat. It’s not too uncommon to find wildlings outside of cities, but they tended to wander the trade routes or at least areas with better shelter.The wildling’s arms are strong enough to fight back, and if he weren’t inhibited by his wolf’s strength, Derek presumes it would be quite a fight. As it were, he pinned the thief easily, chest down and flailing like a huffing like an animal.“Have nothing to say, thief?”--Derek and his pack of werewolves are fur traders working their way through the winter trading route when one evening, a thief is discovered after stealing their wares. entry.title: Lollipop Lanes
entry.summary:
Author: LolliKitty34

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,211Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 3

Summary: It had been a year since Allison Argent, best friend of Lydia Martin and beloved girlfriend of Scott McCall died. And a year since Stiles broke up with Malia and had to endure the Nogitsune’s torturous head games. A lot can happen in a year. Like going to another mental health facility. One that actually helped. And a rather…unlikely person that helped him come out as gay, have a whirlwind romance with and quickly become engaged and then married to a year later. Derek. Derek Hale was his everything. And now their next step was looking for a home together. His PTSD was still acting up as they toured apartments, but Derek will stop at nothing to put a permanent smile on his new husband's face. When a once in a life time opportunity comes up, an add for an apartment above a blank space that used to be a book store….Well…Time will tell if books are really a cure for everything. *ongoing fic*

entry.title: LIKE THE COMING OF SPRING
entry.summary:
Author: TheSaintRyan

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 79,754Chapters: 32/36Kudos: 4

Summary: Three months after leaving to attend Berkeley, Stiles receives a phone call. Twelve years later; Stiles and Derek's son, Eli, is eager to help when a new enemy emerges. The nemeton has been quieted, but things never remain silent forever. When a demonic force threatens the peace in Beacon Hills, the Hale pack must prove that they are stronger than ever.Or;You are in the backyard, lying in the grass. The sun is high and hot. The light is painting the darkness behind your eyes into a vermillion. “You know what you have to do, right?” Laura asks. Last you saw she was filling a wading pool, but the water has stopped running through the hose and as she moves you can hear it sloshing around her shins.“No clue,” you answer. Laura laughs. You've missed that sound so much, and it makes you think about how long it took you after your family died to laugh again. “Last time we spoke you said my grief was too quiet… but it's been a while since I lost anyone.”You hear the water slosh two more times as she steps out of the pool. She walks over to you and stands so close to your arm that you can feel how cold the water is from her feet.“Who says grief must be fresh to be felt?”

entry.title: if couches could talk
entry.summary:
Author: seaweedwater

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 92,162Chapters: 7/?Kudos: 155

Summary: Derek watched Stiles grow into the young man he is now—smart, funny, kind, exceptional, truly gorgeous. He could easily find someone his age who would give him the time of day, but he doesn’t seem interested in a relationship, or anything that could distract him from pining for Derek’s notice.Derek would be lying if he said he didn’t like the attention. He’s careful with it, careful not to indulge him and lead him on, to take advantage, because there’s nothing that could ever happen between them. He’s a child, his son’s best friend, the son of a Sheriff who has a gun rack, and Derek is thirty-six and unhappily married with taxes to pay and a house to maintain.It’s just a fantasy, something Derek lets his mind play with since he knows nothing could ever come of it. If he imagines Stiles’ fingers inside him instead of his own, it’s not like anyone else could ever know that.
